title: Garth_Brooks-The_Ultimate_Hits-2CD-(Retail)-2007-HHI
description:
Artist......: Garth brooks                                                      
               Album.......: The ultimate hits-

               Release Date: Aug-21-2007                                                       
               Rip Date....: Feb-05-2008

               Ripper      : Happy Hacker Industries                                           
               CD Songs    : CD1: 17 CD2: 19                                                   
               Label.......: Pearl                                                             
               Album Info..:                                                                   
                                                                                               
          In a way, it&#039;s like Garth Brooks never retired. He may have stopped touring and      
          releasing new music, but he kept repackaging and reissuing his older albums, striking
          up an exclusive deal with Wal-Mart highlighted by a second box set called The Limited
          Series in 2006. That exclusivity contract expired in the summer of 2007, leaving     
          Brooks a free agent, and he capitalized on his freedom almost immediately, delivering
          the double-disc singles collection The Ultimate Hits just in time for the holiday    
          season of 2007. Where previous Garth repackagings could seem a little unnecessary -- 
          it&#039;s not quite clear just how many of his fans needed that second Limited Series     
          anyway -- The Ultimate Hits actually fills in a needed gap within his catalog, as    
          Brooks hasn&#039;t had a hit compilation since his first, the 1994 The Hits. That disc was
          a "limited edition" at least in theory -- there were so many copies pressed it wasn&#039;t
          exactly rare -- and out of print since the mid-&#039;90s, so it wasn&#039;t available in most  
          retail stores, plus it didn&#039;t cover all the hits he had between its release and his  
          retirement. The Ultimate Hits does exactly that, containing all 18 tracks from The   
          Hits (albeit not in the same sequencing), adding 12 hits that he had in the last half
          of the &#039;90s, along with four new songs highlighted by a cover of Huey Lewis & the    
          News&#039; "Workin&#039; for a Livin&#039;." The new songs are a nice touch, but the real purpose of
          this set is to offer casual fans a way to get all of Brooks&#039; best-known hits in one  
          package, and in that regard The Ultimate Hits not only succeeds, it&#039;s long overdue.  
                                                                                               
                                                                                               
                 Album opinion is taken from sites such as cduniverse and allmusic,            
                 HHI does not express an opinion either way with regard to the quality         
                 of the band etc. We hope you enjoy the music whatever it is!
